channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Consumers' collective feeling about the economy isn't matching our spending behavior
item.description: There's a puzzling split between how consumers overall feel about the economy and how they're acting, how much they are spending overall. Normally spending and feelings go together. Not right now.
item.content:encoded: There's a puzzling split between how consumers overall feel about the economy and how they're acting, how much they are spending overall. Normally spending and feelings go together. Not right now.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Gonzalez

item.title: Israel is seizing an ancient historical site to turn it into a tourist site
item.description: Israeli authorities are encroaching on the ancient site of Sebastia in the West Bank to create a tourist attraction aimed at settlers, raising worries of the displacement of Palestinians.
item.content:encoded: Israeli authorities are encroaching on the ancient site of Sebastia in the West Bank to create a tourist attraction aimed at settlers, raising worries of the displacement of Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Australia to review migration laws after Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Australia looks to review its migration laws and crack down on hate speech following Sunday's mass shooting attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach.
item.content:encoded: Australia looks to review its migration laws and crack down on hate speech following Sunday's mass shooting attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: Millions of Americans will soon be uninsured. Some are looking for a 'plan B'
item.description: Millions of Americans face big increases in ACA insurance premiums in January. Some plan to go without coverage, and pay out of pocket for drugs and doctor visits, despite the risk of medical debt.
item.content:encoded: Millions of Americans face big increases in ACA insurance premiums in January. Some plan to go without coverage, and pay out of pocket for drugs and doctor visits, despite the risk of medical debt.
item.dc:creator: Blake Farmer

item.title: As the holidays near, colleges work to ensure students have enough to eat
item.description: With grocery costs on the rise, it's been a challenging time for college students facing food insecurity. Many are stocking up at food pantries before the end of the semester.
item.content:encoded: With grocery costs on the rise, it's been a challenging time for college students facing food insecurity. Many are stocking up at food pantries before the end of the semester.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: Comedian Kumail Nanjiani on the experience he wishes he could give every person
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Kumail Nanjiani talks about the experience he wishes he could give every person.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Kumail Nanjiani talks about the experience he wishes he could give every person.

item.title: In key Virginia races, Latino voters shift towards Democrats
item.description: In recent elections, some Latino voters are shifting away from the Republican Party. Those votes helped flip seats in Virginia and could be an important factor in next year's midterm elections.
item.content:encoded: In recent elections, some Latino voters are shifting away from the Republican Party. Those votes helped flip seats in Virginia and could be an important factor in next year's midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: Margaret Barthel

item.title: Venezuelans brace for hardship as Trump threatens oil blockade
item.description: President Trump's threat to halt Venezuelan oil sales stirs fear, but for a country long battered by shortages, it's just another crisis.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's threat to halt Venezuelan oil sales stirs fear, but for a country long battered by shortages, it's just another crisis.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: It's Been a Minute explores the pressures, fear, and shame in modern parenting
item.description: From health advice to educational decisions, modern child-rearing can come with a culture of fear that preys on new parents. But there are ways to lessen the pressure and shame around raising kids.
item.content:encoded: From health advice to educational decisions, modern child-rearing can come with a culture of fear that preys on new parents. But there are ways to lessen the pressure and shame around raising kids.
item.dc:creator: Brittany Luse

item.title: The marital standup story 'Is This Thing On?' sneaks up on you like a great punchline
item.description: Bradley Cooper's new relationship dramedy Is This Thing On? is about a man who's never done comedy before, working out his marital problems on a stand-up stage.
item.content:encoded: Bradley Cooper's new relationship dramedy Is This Thing On? is about a man who's never done comedy before, working out his marital problems on a stand-up stage.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello
